docs.title: Install
docs.text:
Install via NPM:

npm install zmdc

You can use this library as JavaScript (ESM) or Typescript. If you need UMD format, you can compile the TypeScript files by yourself, using your toolchain.

docs.title: TypeScript
docs.text:
import {parseExampleFunction, showExampleCode} from 'node_module/zmdc/lib/zmdc.(t|j)s'

The extensions depend on your toolchain!

docs.title: What you want
docs.text:
You have a function formatFancy(). You want to show a usage of this function in a context (left side) and the result (right side):

docs.title: What your don't want to do
docs.text: If you have to rename the function formatFancy to formatColorful, you have to change your example code, too. But you don't want to also change the HTML, where you placed the example code. This library should do it for you.

docs.title: Step 1. Prepare your demonstration
docs.text: Encapsulate the demo code in a function.   Update your HTML to let your demo function work properly.

docs.title: Step 2. Run your demonstration
docs.text: Call your demo function: In this step you can check if your demo function work like you want.

docs.title: Step 3. Mark necessary HTML tags in demonstration function
docs.text:
Before you can let this library show you demo code on DOM, you have to mark these information in your function:

  • In which DOM element should the demo code be shown
  • Which DOM elements needs the demo code to work properly

For the 1. point: TODO

For the 2. point: One comment in form // <tag> for each necessary DOM-element. The demo function here just needs only an element with id="ff-result", so there is only one comment. By this way you can directly denote the demo code, which DOM element it needs to work.
